content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be functions such that <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 4, of, g of x, equals 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></munder><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 4, of, the fraction with numerator f of x, and denominator g of x, end fraction, equals pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 4, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></munder><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: The limit cannot be determined from the information given.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
